title: Ranking the top 20 transfers for the new 2019/20 Gallagher Premiership season - who made the best buy?
text:
A host of top internationals - overseas and domestic - have been swapping clubs ahead of the upcoming Gallagher Premiership season, which starts on Friday with the West Country derby between Bristol and Bath.

Here, we rank the most exciting transfers so far.

20. Dave Attwood (Bath to Bristol)

The hard-nosed, 24-cap Englishman returns to the city of his birth, university and first professional club an older and wiser player. Arguably the best scrummaging lock in the country, and once at Toulon, he could start alongside Chris Vui in a seriously punchy second row for Friday's season opener against former club Bath.

19. Joe Simpson (Wasps to Gloucester)

Simpson may struggle dislodging Eddie Jones'...
